s.text: Originally incorporated in 1923 as the Legal Aid Society of Albany, it now serves income- eligible clients in eight counties throughout the Capital Region.
Because we lack sufficient public and private support, the dedicated attorneys and staff at LASNNY are limited in their ability to serve all those in need.
Originally incorporated in 1923 as the Legal Aid Society of Albany, it now serves income- eligible clients in eight counties throughout the Capital Region.

Originally incorporated in 1923 as the Legal Aid Society of Albany, it now serves income- eligible clients in eight counties throughout the Capital Region.

Unfortunately, there was no mention of the Capital Region's own Legal Aid Society of Northeastern New York, the nonprofit organization that works to ensure that justice is available to the poor, the disabled and the endangered members of our community.
LASNNY provides only needed civil legal aid -- urgent, noncriminal assistance to low-income people.
Last year, the LASNNY helped more than 14,000 people.

Won 87 SSI/SSD cases enabling clients to receive $850,016 in retroactive benefits, saving state taxpayers $441,786 and enabling people with disabilities to live with dignity.
